answers.answer:
For children, essential nutrition guidelines include prioritizing breastfeeding for infants, ensuring access to clean drinking water, and stocking non-perishable, ready-to-eat foods like canned goods, nuts, and instant cereals, particularly during emergencies. A balanced diet, including vegetables, is crucial for their well-being and immunity.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read under the sections 'Breastfeeding' and 'Nutrition for small children'.
answers.bResponse:

A balanced diet, including vegetables, is crucial for their well-being and immunity.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read under the sections 'Breastfeeding' and 'Nutrition for small children'. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
Breastfeeding is considered crucial for a baby's immunity and well-being because breast milk strengthens the child's immune system and contains all the necessary substances for their health. It also provides important physical contact that helps the baby feel safe and is the most convenient and safest feeding method.

You can find more detailed information on the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition` under the "Breastfeeding" section.

answers.answer:
Stress and anxiety generally do not affect a mother's breast milk production or quality. In rare cases, stress may slow down the milk flow, which can be addressed by frequent breastfeeding.

You can find more detailed information on this topic by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and looking under the "Breastfeeding" section.

answers.answer:
Experts recommend feeding breastfed babies on demand, as often as the child wants, but at least 8-12 times a day, for as long as the child wants.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition` and read under the "Breastfeeding" section.

To find more detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition` and read under the "Breastfeeding" section. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
Continuing breastfeeding during emergencies provides crucial physical comfort and security for both mother and child, strengthens the child's immunity against stress-weakened health, and offers a safe, convenient, and complete source of nutrition, even when other food sources are scarce or unavailable.

To find more detailed information, please go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read under the section "Why it is especially important to continue breastfeeding in an emergency".
answers.bResponse:

To find more detailed information, please go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read under the section "Why it is especially important to continue breastfeeding in an emergency". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
If a mother is temporarily separated from her baby, she should continue to drain milk with her hands or a breast pump as often as the child would eat, but at least 8 times a day, to maintain lactation.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read under the section "What if your baby can't breastfed or he is not with you".
answers.bResponse:
If a mother is temporarily separated from her baby, she should continue to drain milk with her hands or a breast pump as often as the child would eat, but at least 8 times a day, to maintain lactation.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read under the section "What if your baby can't breastfed or he is not with you". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
To restore a decreased milk supply, a mother should frequently put the baby to the breast, even if there is no milk, drink more water, massage the neck area, get enough rest, and try to eat well, including something sweet or favorite foods. Taking a warm shower can also be helpful.

You can find more detailed information on this topic by visiting the website and looking under the section "What to do if you cannot continue breastfeeding."
answers.bResponse:

You can find more detailed information on this topic by visiting the website and looking under the section "What to do if you cannot continue breastfeeding." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
Babies under six months old can be fed ready-to-use commercial or generic infant formula suitable for their age. If using dry formula, boil water above 70 degrees Celsius for preparation, avoid preparing in advance unless refrigerated for a short time, and ideally use a cup for feeding instead of a bottle.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and look under the section "What to do if you cannot continue breastfeeding."
answers.bResponse:

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and look under the section "What to do if you cannot continue breastfeeding." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
Dry infant formula is not sterile and requires careful preparation; boil water above 70 degrees Celsius before mixing to kill bacteria, avoid preparing it in advance, and use a cup for feeding instead of a bottle.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read under the section titled "If you can not restore lactation".
answers.bResponse:

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read under the section titled "If you can not restore lactation". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
Children older than six months can be fed animal milk (cow's or goat's), including ultra-pasteurized, and complementary foods such as instant cereals, mashed meat, fish, and vegetables. They do not require formula.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and refer to the section "What to do if you cannot continue breastfeeding" or "Nutrition for small children".
answers.bResponse:

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and refer to the section "What to do if you cannot continue breastfeeding" or "Nutrition for small children". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
To ensure access to clean drinking water for children during an emergency, create an advance supply of drinking water stored in closed containers, disinfecting it if stored for a long time. Avoid drinking water from untested sources.

You can find more detailed information on the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition` under the "Nutrition for small children" section, specifically the "Water" subsection.
answers.bResponse:

You can find more detailed information on the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition` under the "Nutrition for small children" section, specifically the "Water" subsection. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition

answers.answer:
For an emergency food supply for children, recommended ready-to-eat foods include instant cereals, ready meals such as mashed meat, fish, and vegetables, along with general items like bread, cookies, crackers, canned foods (meat, fish, vegetables), nuts, seeds, dried fruits, chocolate, energy bars, apples, and bananas.

You can find this detailed information on the website dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition, specifically under the sections 'Food on the go' and 'Nutrition for small children'.

answers.answer:
Breastfeeding mothers can find support and counseling services in Romania through the Support for refugee women program, which guides them to necessary services regardless of their location. Additionally, the Romanian Association of Consultants in Lactation and the Association of Independent Midwives offer help, including phone or free online consultations, which can be accessed by calling +40725278273 or visiting https://uni.cf/395dQyb.

To find this information on the webpage, go to the section titled "Difficulties with breastfeeding?" and "IMPORTANT" within the "Children’s nutrition" content block.

answers.answer:
Yes, you can call +40725278273 for assistance from the Romanian Association of Consultants in Lactation and the Association of Independent Midwives, who help refugee pregnant women, breastfeeding women, and mothers with infants or children from Ukraine. Consultations can be held in English or with Ukrainian translation.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and look under the section titled "IMPORTANT" near the end of the "Children's nutrition" part.

answers.answer:
Additional resources for information on women's health and breastfeeding are available through the Women Center platform and organizations like the Romanian Association of Consultants in Lactation and the Association of Independent Midwives.

To find detailed information, visit the Women Center platform via https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition. For direct support and consultations, contact the Romanian Association of Consultants in Lactation and the Association of Independent Midwives by calling +40725278273 or visiting https://uni.cf/395dQyb.
